basics.summary: Applied Mathematics graduate and Research Assistant with strong background in mathematical modeling, data-driven hydrometeorological analysis, and scientific computing.

work.name: Department of Applied Mathematics, Noakhali Science and Technology University
work.summary: Worked under the supervision of Dr. Md. Jamal Hossain, Professor, assisting in developing and typesetting course materials and project documents using LaTeX.

projects.name: Threshold-Based Flood Risk Alert System in Flood-Prone Regions of Bangladesh
projects.summary: Developed rainfall prediction models using SARIMAX, XGBoost, and Decision Tree classification for hydrometeorological analysis and implemented a threshold-based flood risk alert system.

extracurricular.summary: Spearheaded the planning and execution of International Mathematics Day 2023 celebrations, programming contests, and quiz competitions; organized events and managed small project teams for academic purposes.
Provided financial assistance and essential goods to nearly 200 people affected by post-COVID economic hardship; organized and led winter clothing drives across multiple regions.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.
